page.title: 18Freshbrook School
page.content: In contrast to Lydiard,Freshbrook was completed in June 1981 at a cost of Â£1 mill. A{staff of 19}looks after{529 {children}in 14 classrooms . As most of the children live within a mile of the school on the whole they walk to school there being no school bus. The school is divided into 2 buildings {The Birches and The Willows}both with their own halls which are equipped for use as{gyms}with wall bars , horses and ropes. Out side there is a football pitch , a netball pitch , play grounds and{a garden}for the children to grow things in. The interior is spacious with many pictures and flowers to give a friendly atmosphere although the tables appeared to be rather too small for the older children .The{school {uniform}is blue jumpers,red ties and black trousers or skirts .
